DataElement.preferredName: Subsequent Known Primary Cutaneous Melanoma During Follow-up Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not additional known primary melanoma was present during follow-up time period.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subsequent Known Primary Cutaneous Melanoma During Follow-up
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order._Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.:Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Concepts.definition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
